title: Calgary-based Firm, McLeod Law Helps Preserve the Past for Future Generations
text:
CALGARY, Alberta — McLeod Law has adopted Heritage Park’s High River Law Office historical building, contributing to the preservation of the Park’s priceless artifacts. Managing Partner, Robin Lokhorst comments, “We all share a commitment to making a positive impact in our communities and this historic building is just one more way we are doing that”.

McLeod Law is helping preserve part of Alberta’s history for future generations.

The law office symbolizes Alberta’s economic boom of the early 1900s. High River’s first lawyer, James Varley, worked out of this building in 1904 and, in 1908, native Manitoban, Alexander McCorquodale ran his legal career out of the building for 40 years. Mr. McCorquodale’s practice focused on real estate law which is one of the founding areas of McLeod Law. The Calgary Bar Association donated the building in 1967 to Heritage Park and was fully restored 30 years later.

About McLeod Law LLP

We’re in the business of helping people, and that will never change. McLeod Law LLP opened its doors in 1980 as a two-person operation. Now a team of 50+ lawyers, our size and depth of experience mean every client engagement is scaled accordingly for an efficient and effective result.
